statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Mary's stays undefeated in WCC, beats BYU 82-77

images.name: 1H SMC K. Carter made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by B. Waldow.
images.caption: 1H (18:26) SMC Kerry Carter made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by Brad Waldow.

article.linkText: Saint Mary's stays undefeated in WCC, beats BYU 82-77
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. -- Brad Waldow had 24 points and 14 rebounds on Saturday night and Saint Mary's won its ninth straight, beating Brigham Young 82-77. Aaron Bright's pair of free throws with 23.9 seconds left extended Saint Mary's (15-3, 7-0 West Coast) lead to five, and BYU missed a pair of 3-point attempts in the final seconds. The Gaels will visit No. 3 Gonzaga on Thursday with both teams undefeated in conference play. Garrett Jackson added 20 points and nine rebounds for the Gaels. Saint Mary's led the entire the second half, but BYU (15-6, 5-3) rallied within 75-72 with 2:25 left. Skylar Halford hit a transition 3-pointer off Corbin Kaufusi's block to get the Cougars back within three at 80-77. Waldow moved ahead of Robert Haugen (1985-89) into sixth place on Saint Mary's career scoring list with 1,523. Tyler Haws led BYU with 28 points and Chase Fischer added 19.
